memhandler.c

00002 #include "../headers/memhandler.h"
00003 
00004 /*
00005 
00006 ## GENERAL INFORMATION
00007 ##
00008 ## FILE                                         memhandler.h
00009 ## AUTHORS                                      P. Schmidtke and V. Le Guilloux
00010 ## LAST MODIFIED                        28-11-08
00011 ##
00012 ## SPECIFICATIONS
00013 ##
00014 ##      This file implements a memory handler. Whenever you call 
00015 ##      my_bloc_malloc function, the allocated pointer will be 
00016 ##      stored in a simple chained list. Then, if a malloc fails, 
00017 ##      or if you call the my_exit function, all allocated variable 
00018 ##      will be freed if not NULL of course. Therefore, a bloc 
00019 ##      allocated by my_... functions MUST be freed by the my_free, 
00020 ##      or a double free error should appears.
00021 ##
00022 ##      WARNING
00023 ##
00024 ##      This is an easy way to handle memory. However, if many bloc 
00025 ##      are allocated and removed during the programm, it might be 
00026 ##      solwed down as for each free, as we have to look for the bloc 
00027 ##      to free in the list, and remove it.
00028 ##
00029 ##      REMEMBER: if you use my_malloc, you MUST use my_free. If you 
00030 ##      free a bloc allocated by my_(..), and if you call free_all at 
00031 ##      the end, a double free coprruption will occure.
00032 ##
00033 ## MODIFICATIONS HISTORY
00034 ##
00035 ##      28-11-08        (v)  Comments UTD
00036 ##      01-04-08        (v)  Added comments and creation of history
00037 ##      01-01-08        (vp) Created (random date...)
00038 ##      
00039 ## TODO or SUGGESTIONS
00040 ##
00041 
00042 */
00043 
00044

00077 /**< Pointer node of a chained list */
00078 
00079 typedef struct ptr_node 
00080 {
00081         struct ptr_node *next ; /**< next pointer node*/
00082         void *ptr ; /**< pointer to void*/
00083 
00084 } ptr_node ;
00085 
00086 /**< Simple chained structures to store allocated pointers */
00087 typedef struct
00088 {
00089         ptr_node *first ;   /**< first pointer of the chained list*/
00090         ptr_node *last ; /**< last pointer in the chained list*/
00091 
00092         size_t n_ptr ; /**< size of the chained list*/
00093 
00094 } ptr_lst ;
00095 
00096 
00097 static ptr_lst *ST_lst_alloc = NULL ;/* A list containing all the allocated pointers. */
00098 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00099 static FILE *ST_fdebug = NULL ;
00100 #endif
00101 
00102 static ptr_node* ptr_node_alloc(void *ptr) ;
00103 static void add_bloc(void *bloc) ; 
00104 static void remove_bloc(void *bloc) ;
00105 
00106 
00107 /**
00108    ## FUNCTION: 
00109         my_malloc
00110   
00111    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00112         Allocate memory for a bloc of size s.
00113   
00114    ## PARAMETRES:
00115         @ size_t s : Size of the bloc to allocate
00116   
00117    ## RETURN:
00118         void *: Pointer to the allocated bloc
00119   
00120 */
00121 void* my_malloc(size_t s)
00122 {
00123         void *bloc = malloc(s) ;
00124 
00125         if(bloc == NULL) {
00126                 fprintf(stderr, "! malloc failed in my_bloc_malloc. Programm will exit, as demanded.\n") ;
00127                 my_exit() ;
00128         }
00129 
00130         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00131         if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> (M)Allocation success at: <%p>\n", bloc) ;
00132         #endif
00133         add_bloc(bloc) ;
00134 
00135         return bloc ;
00136 }
00137 
00138 /**
00139    ## FUNCTION: 
00140         my_calloc
00141   
00142    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00143         Allocate memory for nb bloc of size s using calloc standart function.
00144   
00145    ## PARAMETRES:
00146         @ size_t nb : Number of bloc to allocate
00147         @ size_t s  : Size of the bloc to allocate
00148   
00149    ## RETURN:
00150         void *: Pointer to the allocated bloc
00151   
00152 */
00153 void* my_calloc(size_t nb, size_t s)
00154 {
00155         void *bloc = calloc(nb, s) ;
00156 
00157         if(bloc == NULL){
00158                 fprintf(stderr, "! malloc failed in my_bloc_malloc. Programm will exit, as demanded.\n") ;
00159                 my_exit() ;
00160         }
00161         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00162         if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> (C)Allocation success at: <%p>\n", bloc) ;
00163         #endif
00164         add_bloc(bloc) ;
00165 
00166         return bloc ;
00167 }
00168 
00169 /**
00170    ## FUNCTION: 
00171         my_realloc
00172   
00173    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00174         Allocate memory for a bloc of size s using calloc standart function.
00175   
00176    ## PARAMETRES:
00177         @ size_t s : Size of the bloc to allocate
00178         @ int exit : Whether we exit the programm if malloc fails.
00179   
00180    ## RETURN:
00181         void *: Pointer to the allocated bloc
00182   
00183 */
00184 void* my_realloc(void *ptr, size_t s)
00185 {
00186         void *tmp = ptr ;
00187         ptr = realloc(ptr, s) ;
00188 
00189         if(ptr == NULL){
00190                 fprintf(stderr, "! malloc failed in my_bloc_malloc. Programm will exit, as demanded.\n") ;
00191                 my_exit() ;
00192         }
00193         else {
00194                 if(tmp && tmp != ptr) {
00195                 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00196                          if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> Realloc generates a new pointer: <%p> newly allocated at %p. \n", tmp, ptr) ;
00197                 #endif
00198 
00199         /* If the newly allocated pointer is different from previou s
00200            one, remove previous from the list and add new one. Else, 
00201            ptr doesn't need to be added. */
00202                         remove_bloc(tmp) ;
00203                         add_bloc(ptr) ;
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 
00207         return ptr ;
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 /**
00212    ## FONCTION: 
00213         ptr_node_alloc
00214   
00215    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00216         Allocate a simple chained node.
00217   
00218    ## PARAMETRES:
00219         @ void *ptr: Pointer
00220   
00221    ## RETURN:
00222         ptr_node*
00223   
00224 */
00225 static ptr_node* ptr_node_alloc(void *ptr)
00226 {
00227         ptr_node *node = (ptr_node *) malloc(sizeof(ptr_node)) ;
00228 
00229         if(node) {
00230                 node->ptr = ptr ;
00231                 node->next = NULL ;
00232         }
00233         else {
00234                 fprintf(stderr, "! malloc failed in my_bloc_malloc. Programm will exit, as demanded.\n") ;
00235                 my_exit() ;
00236         }
00237         
00238         return node ;
00239 }
00240 
00241 
00242 /**
00243    ## FUNCTION: 
00244         my_free
00245   
00246    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00247         Free memory for the given bloc, and remove this pointer from the list.
00248   
00249    ## PARAMETRES:
00250         @ void *bloc: Pointer to free.
00251   
00252    ## RETURN:
00253   
00254 */
00255 void my_free(void *bloc) 
00256 {
00257         if(bloc) {
00258         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00259                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> (my_free) Freeing bloc <%p>!\n", bloc) ;
00260                 fflush(ST_fdebug) ;
00261         #endif
00262                 remove_bloc(bloc) ;
00263                 free(bloc) ;
00264         }
00265         else {
00266         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00267                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "! Cannot free a NULL variable!\n") ;
00268         #endif
00269         }
00270 
00271 }
00272 
00273 /**
00274    ## FUNCTION: 
00275         static add_bloc
00276   
00277    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00278         Add an allocated pointer (bloc) to the list ST_lst_alloc. 
00279 
00280         This function is supposed to be called by my_malloc, my_calloc or my_realloc 
00281         functions only.
00282   
00283    ## PARAMETRES:
00284         @ void *bloc: The pointer to remove
00285   
00286    ## RETURN:
00287   
00288 */
00289 static void add_bloc(void *bloc) 
00290 {       
00291         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00292                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> Adding bloc %p\n", bloc) ;
00293         #endif
00294 
00295         /* First check if the list exists, if not create it. */
00296         if(!ST_lst_alloc) {
00297 
00298                 ST_lst_alloc = (ptr_lst*) malloc(sizeof(ptr_lst)) ;
00299                 if(!ST_lst_alloc) {
00300                         fprintf(stderr, "! malloc failed in add_bloc while creating the list. Programm will exit.\n") ;
00301                         my_exit() ;
00302                 }
00303                 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00304                         ST_fdebug = fopen("memory_debug.tmp", "w") ;
00305                 #endif
00306 
00307                 ST_lst_alloc->first = NULL ;
00308                 ST_lst_alloc->last = NULL ;
00309                 ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr = 0 ;
00310         }
00311 
00312         /* Now add the bloc to the chained list */
00313 
00314         ptr_node *newn = ptr_node_alloc(bloc) ;
00315         if(ST_lst_alloc->first) {
00316                 newn->next = ST_lst_alloc->first ;
00317                 ST_lst_alloc->first = newn ;
00318         }
00319         else {
00320                 ST_lst_alloc->first = newn ;
00321                 ST_lst_alloc->last = newn ;
00322         }
00323 
00324         ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr += 1 ;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /**
00328    ## FUNCTION: 
00329         static remove_bloc
00330   
00331    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00332         Remove the given pointer (node) from the list ST_lst_alloc. Donc free the
00333         memory.
00334 
00335         This function is supposed to be called by my_free function and not another.
00336   
00337    ## PARAMETRES:
00338         @ void *bloc: The pointer to remove.
00339   
00340    ## RETURN:   void
00341   
00342 */
00343 static void remove_bloc(void *bloc)
00344 {
00345 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00346         size_t i = 0 ;
00347 #endif
00348         /* First check if the list exists, if not create it. */
00349 
00350         if(ST_lst_alloc) {
00351 
00352                 ptr_node *cur = ST_lst_alloc->first,
00353                                  *prev = cur ;
00354         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00355                 if(!cur && ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> No element in the list, so cannot remove <%p>...\n", bloc) ;
00356                 size_t prev_s = ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr ;
00357         #endif
00358                 while(cur) {
00359                         if(cur->ptr == bloc) {
00360                         /* Remove bloc */
00361                                 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00362                                         if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> Removing <%p>...\n", cur->ptr) ;
00363                                 #endif
00364                                 if(cur == ST_lst_alloc->first) {
00365                                         ST_lst_alloc->first = cur->next ;
00366                                 }
00367                                 else if(cur == ST_lst_alloc->last) {
00368                                         ST_lst_alloc->last = prev ;
00369                                         prev->next = NULL ;
00370                                 }
00371                                 else {
00372                                         prev->next = cur->next ;
00373                                 }
00374 
00375                                 cur->next = NULL ;
00376                                 free(cur) ;
00377                                 ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr -= 1 ;
00378 
00379                                 break ;
00380                         }
00381                 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00382                         i++ ;
00383                 #endif
00384 
00385                         prev = cur ;
00386                         cur = cur->next ;
00387                 }
00388         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00389                 if(i == prev_s && ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "Memhandler: <%p> not found!\n", bloc) ;
00390         #endif
00391         }
00392 
00393         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00394         else {
00395                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "! No bloc allocated -> cannot remove given argument from an empty list.\n") ;
00396         }       
00397         #endif
00398 }
00399 
00400 /**
00401    ## FUNCTION: 
00402         free_all 
00403   
00404    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00405         Free all pointers allocated and present in the list ST_lst_alloc. If a
00406         NULL pointer is found, ignore it.
00407   
00408    ## PARAMETRES:       void
00409   
00410    ## RETURN:   void
00411   
00412 */
00413 void free_all(void) 
00414 {
00415         if(ST_lst_alloc) {
00416 
00417                 ptr_node *cur = ST_lst_alloc->first,
00418                                  *tmp = cur ;
00419                 while(cur) {
00420                         if(cur->ptr) {
00421                         #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00422                                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "> Freeing <%p>.\n", cur->ptr) ;
00423                         #endif
00424                                 free(cur->ptr) ;
00425                                 cur->ptr = NULL ;
00426                         }
00427                 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00428                         else {
00429                                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "! A NULL bloc has been found in free_all!! Ignoring this bloc...\n") ;
00430                         }
00431                 #endif
00432 
00433                         tmp = cur->next ;
00434                         cur->next = NULL ;
00435                         free(cur) ;
00436 
00437                         cur = tmp ;
00438                 }
00439                 
00440                 free(ST_lst_alloc) ;
00441                 ST_lst_alloc = NULL ;
00442 
00443         }
00444 #ifdef M_MEM_DEBUG
00445         else {
00446                 if(ST_fdebug) fprintf(ST_fdebug, "! No bloc allocated -> cannot free memory...\n") ;
00447         }
00448 #endif
00449 }
00450  
00451 /**
00452    ## FUNCTION: 
00453         my_exit
00454   
00455    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00456         Before exiting the programm, just free all allocated pointers (if any). This
00457         allows to exit the programme whenever one wants during the execution without
00458         dealing with memory allocation/desallocation.
00459 
00460         This implies to use my_malloc and my_free functions instead of standart
00461         functions. Only memory blocs allocated with those functions will be freed
00462         when my_exit is called.
00463   
00464    ## PARAMETRES:       void
00465   
00466    ## RETURN:   void
00467   
00468 */
00469 void my_exit(void) 
00470 {
00471         free_all() ;
00472 
00473         exit(1) ;
00474 }
00475 
00476 /**
00477    ## FUNCTION: 
00478         print_ptr_lst 
00479   
00480    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00481         Print allocated pointers stored in ST_lst_alloc for debugging purpose.
00482   
00483    ## PARAMETRES:       void
00484   
00485    ## RETURN:   void
00486   
00487 */
00488 void print_ptr_lst(void) 
00489 {
00490         if(ST_lst_alloc && ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr > 0) {
00491                 int i = 0 ;
00492                 ptr_node *cur = ST_lst_alloc->first ;
00493                 fprintf(stdout, "\t==============\n\tLst of %d allocated ptr: \n", (int) ST_lst_alloc->n_ptr) ;
00494                 fprintf(stdout, "\tFirst: <%p> - Last: <%p>\n", ST_lst_alloc->first->ptr, ST_lst_alloc->last->ptr) ;
00495                 
00496                 while(cur) {
00497                         if(cur->ptr) {
00498                                 fprintf(stdout, "\t<%p> <%d>\n", cur->ptr, (int)sizeof(cur->ptr)) ;
00499                         }
00500                         else {
00501                                 fprintf(stdout, "\t! A NULL bloc has been found in position %d.\n", i) ;
00502                         }
00503 
00504                         cur = cur->next ;
00505                 }
00506         }
00507         else {
00508                 fprintf(stdout, "\t! No bloc allocated yet...\n") ;
00509         }
00510 }
